org.jsapar.convert

Class AbstractConverter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jsapar.convert.AbstractConverter
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BeanCollection2TextConverter, Text2BeanConverter, Text2StringConverter, Text2TextConverter, Xml2TextConverter

    public abstract class AbstractConverter
extends Object
    Abstract base class for all converters.

    By adding a LineManipulator you are able to make modifications of each line before it is written to the output. The method LineManipulator.manipulate(Line) of all added LineManipulators are called for each line that are parsed successfully.

    For each line, the line type of the parsed line is considered when choosing the line type of the output schema line. This means that lines with a type that does not exist in the output schema will be discarded in the output.

    If your want lines to be discarded from the output depending of their contents, add a LineManipulator that returns false for the lines that should not be composed.

    The default error handling is to throw an exception upon the first error that occurs. You can however change that behavior by adding an ErrorEventListener. There are several implementations to choose from such as RecordingErrorEventListener or ThresholdRecordingErrorEventListener, or you may implement your own.

        public void addLineManipulator(LineManipulator manipulator)

                throws IOException
        Executes the convert task and applies all manipulators in order..
